content: I just noticed that the table is not rendered properly in the module docstring of https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib_docs/order/filter/interval.html Is this a recent bug, or was rendering markdown tables never a feature of the site ?
Hmm. I don't think it's new. markdown2 doesn't like this table even with the tables extra (which might need to be added to the docs). But it displays right in Bryan's observable preview.
@Bryan Gin-ge Chen any clue?
The mistletoe renderer that we use for the main website seems to handle the table just fine.

I can reproduce with

import markdown2
s = """\
| Input filter |  `Ixx = Icc`  |  `Ixx = Ico`  |  `Ixx = Ioc`  |  `Ixx = Ioo`  |
| -----------: | :-----------: | :-----------: | :-----------: | :-----------: |
|     `at_top` |    `at_top`   |    `at_top`   |    `at_top`   |    `at_top`   |
|     `at_bot` |    `at_bot`   |    `at_bot`   |    `at_bot`   |    `at_bot`   |
|     `pure a` |    `pure a`   |      `âŠ¥`      |      `âŠ¥`      |      `âŠ¥`      |
|  `ğ“Ÿ (Iic a)` |  `ğ“Ÿ (Iic a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Iio a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Iic a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Iio a)`  |
|  `ğ“Ÿ (Ici a)` |  `ğ“Ÿ (Ici a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Ici a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Ioi a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Ioi a)`  |
|  `ğ“Ÿ (Ioi a)` |  `ğ“Ÿ (Ioi a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Ioi a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Ioi a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Ioi a)`  |
|  `ğ“Ÿ (Iio a)` |  `ğ“Ÿ (Iio a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Iio a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Iio a)`  |  `ğ“Ÿ (Iio a)`  |
|        `ğ“ a` |     `ğ“ a`     |     `ğ“ a`     |     `ğ“ a`     |     `ğ“ a`     |
| `ğ“[Iic a] b` |  `ğ“[Iic a] b` |  `ğ“[Iio a] b` |  `ğ“[Iic a] b` |  `ğ“[Iio a] b` |
| `ğ“[Ici a] b` |  `ğ“[Ici a] b` |  `ğ“[Ici a] b` |  `ğ“[Ioi a] b` |  `ğ“[Ioi a] b` |
| `ğ“[Ioi a] b` |  `ğ“[Ioi a] b` |  `ğ“[Ioi a] b` |  `ğ“[Ioi a] b` |  `ğ“[Ioi a] b` |
| `ğ“[Iio a] b` |  `ğ“[Iio a] b` |  `ğ“[Iio a] b` |  `ğ“[Iio a] b` |  `ğ“[Iio a] b` |
"""
markdown2.markdown(s)
Everything works fine for me with extras=['tables'] though
